 1	import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 2	import { DatabaseService, initializeDatabase } from '@/lib/database';
 3	import { requireAuth, canAccessCase } from '@/lib/server-auth';
 4	
 5	export async function GET(
 6	 request: NextRequest,
 7	 context: { params: Promise<{ id: string }> }
 8	) {
 9	 try {
 10	 // Initialize database if needed
 11	 initializeDatabase();
 12	 
 13	 // Authenticate user
 14	 const authResult = await requireAuth(request);
 15	 if (authResult instanceof Response) {
 16	 return authResult; // Return error response
 17	 }
 18	 
 19	 const { user } = authResult;
 20	 const params = await context.params;
 21	 const { id } = params;
 22	 
 23	 // Try to get case by ID first, then by case number if not found
 24	 let caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseById(id);
 25	 if (!caseData) {
 26	 // Try by case number
 27	 caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseByCaseNumber(id);
 28	 }
 29	 
 30	 if (!caseData) {
 31	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Case not found' }, { status: 404 });
 32	 }
 33	 
 34	 // Check if user can access this case
 35	 if (!canAccessCase(user, (caseData as any).workspaceId)) {
 36	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Access denied' }, { status: 403 });
 37	 }
 38	 
 39	 return NextResponse.json(caseData);
 40	 } catch (error) {
 41	 console.error('Error fetching case:', error);
 42	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to fetch case' }, { status: 500 });
 43	 }
 44	}
 45	
 46	export async function PUT(
 47	 request: NextRequest,
 48	 context: { params: Promise<{ id: string }> }
 49	) {
 50	 try {
 51	 // Initialize database if needed
 52	 initializeDatabase();
 53	 
 54	 // Authenticate user
 55	 const authResult = await requireAuth(request);
 56	 if (authResult instanceof Response) {
 57	 return authResult; // Return error response
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 const { user } = authResult;
 61	 const params = await context.params;
 62	 const { id } = params;
 63	 
 64	 // First check if case exists and user can access it
 65	 let caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseById(id);
 66	 if (!caseData) {
 67	 // Try by case number
 68	 caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseByCaseNumber(id);
 69	 }
 70	 
 71	 if (!caseData) {
 72	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Case not found' }, { status: 404 });
 73	 }
 74	 
 75	 if (!canAccessCase(user, (caseData as any).workspaceId)) {
 76	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Access denied' }, { status: 403 });
 77	 }
 78	
 79	 const updates = await request.json();
 80	 
 81	 // Prevent workspace users from changing workspace assignment 
 82	 if (user.role === 'workspace_user' && updates.workspace_id && updates.workspace_id !== user.workspace_id) {
 83	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Cannot modify workspace assignment' }, { status: 403 });
 84	 }
 85	 
 86	 // Use the actual database ID for the update, not the parameter which might be case number
 87	 await DatabaseService.updateCase((caseData as any).id, updates);
 88	 return NextResponse.json({ success: true });
 89	 } catch (error) {
 90	 console.error('Error updating case:', error);
 91	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to update case' }, { status: 500 });
 92	 }
 93	}
 94	
 95	export async function DELETE(
 96	 request: NextRequest,
 97	 context: { params: Promise<{ id: string }> }
 98	) {
 99	 try {
 100	 // Initialize database if needed
 101	 initializeDatabase();
 102	 
 103	 // Authenticate user (require admin for deletion)
 104	 const authResult = await requireAuth(request);
 105	 if (authResult instanceof Response) {
 106	 return authResult; // Return error response
 107	 }
 108	 
 109	 const { user } = authResult;
 110	 
 111	 // Only admins can delete cases
 112	 if (user.role !== 'admin' && user.role !== 'developer') {
 113	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Admin access required for deletion' }, { status: 403 });
 114	 }
 115	
 116	 const params = await context.params;
 117	 const { id } = params;
 118	 
 119	 // First check if case exists
 120	 let caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseById(id);
 121	 if (!caseData) {
 122	 // Try by case number
 123	 caseData = await DatabaseService.getCaseByCaseNumber(id);
 124	 }
 125	 
 126	 if (!caseData) {
 127	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Case not found' }, { status: 404 });
 128	 }
 129	 
 130	 await DatabaseService.deleteCase((caseData as any).id);
 131	 return NextResponse.json({ success: true });
 132	 } catch (error) {
 133	 console.error('Error deleting case:', error);
 134	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to delete case' }, { status: 500 });
 135	 }
 136	}

 1	"use client";
 2	
 3	import { useRef, useState } from 'react';
 4	
 5	export default function LoginPage() {
 6	 const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
 7	 const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false);
 8	 const emailRef = useRef<HTMLInputElement>(null);
 9	 const passwordRef = useRef<HTMLInputElement>(null);
 10	
 11	 const handleLogin = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
 12	 e.preventDefault();
 13	
 14	 const form = e.target as HTMLFormElement;
 15	 const formData = new FormData(form);
 16	 const email = formData.get("email") as string;
 17	 const password = formData.get("password") as string;
 18	
 19	 setMessage("Attempting login...");
 20	 setIsLoading(true);
 21	
 22	 try {
 23	 // Use API route which seeds dev accounts, authenticates, and sets httpOnly cookie
 24	 const res = await fetch("/api/auth/simple-login", {
 25	 method: "POST",
 26	 headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
 27	 body: JSON.stringify({ email, password }),
 28	 });
 29	
 30	 const data = await res.json();
 31	
 32	 if (!res.ok || !data?.success) {
 33	 setMessage(" Invalid credentials.");
 34	 setIsLoading(false);
 35	 return;
 36	 }
 37	
 38	 // Store a minimal client copy for UI convenience (non-authoritative)
 39	 const userData = {
 40	 id: data.user.id,
 41	 email: data.user.email,
 42	 name: data.user.name ?? "User",
 43	 role: data.user.role ?? "user",
 44	 workspaceId: null,
 45	 };
 46	 sessionStorage.setItem("currentUser", JSON.stringify(userData));
 47	 window.dispatchEvent(
 48	 new CustomEvent("sessionStorageChange", {
 49	 detail: { key: "currentUser", value: userData },
 50	 })
 51	 );
 52	
 53	 setMessage(" Login successful! Redirecting...");
 54	
 55	 // Check if this is the user's first login
 56	 if (data.firstLogin) {
 57	 // Redirect to first-login page
 58	 setTimeout(() => {
 59	 try {
 60	 window.location.href = "/first-login";
 61	 } catch {
 62	 try {
 63	 window.location.replace("/first-login");
 64	 } catch {
 65	 window.location.assign("/first-login");
 66	 }
 67	 }
 68	 }, 200);
 69	 } else {
 70	 // Redirect to next or dashboard
 71	 const url = new URL(window.location.href);
 72	 const next = url.searchParams.get("next") || "/";
 73	 setTimeout(() => {
 74	 try {
 75	 window.location.href = next;
 76	 } catch {
 77	 try {
 78	 window.location.replace(next);
 79	 } catch {
 80	 window.location.assign(next);
 81	 }
 82	 }
 83	 }, 200);
 84	 }
 85	 } catch (err) {
 86	 console.error("Login error:", err);
 87	 setMessage(" Login failed. Please try again.");
 88	 setIsLoading(false);
 89	 }
 90	 };
 91	
 92	 const autoFillDev1 = () => {
 93	 if (emailRef.current) emailRef.current.value = "whitepointer2016@gmail.com";
 94	 if (passwordRef.current) passwordRef.current.value = "Tr@ders84";
 95	 };
 96

 63	 role: (auth.user as any).role,

 65	 },
 66	 firstLogin: firstLogin,

 73	 });

 76	 res.cookies.set('wpa_auth', cookiePayload, {

 94	 sameSite: 'lax',
 95	 path: '/',
 96	 maxAge: 60 * 60 * 12,
 97	 });
 98	
 99	 return res;
 100	 } catch (error) {

 1	"use client";

 3	import { useEffect, useState } from "react";
 4	import { useParams, useRouter } from 'next/navigation';
 5	import { useLocalStorage } from "@/hooks/use-local-storage";
 6	import type { CaseFrontend as Case, ContactFrontend as Contact } from "@/lib/database-schema";
 7	import type { BikeFrontend } from "@/lib/database-schema";
 8	import { useAuth } from "@/context/AuthContext";
 9	import { cookieForwardFetch } from "@/lib/auth-fetch";
 10	import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardFooter } from "@/components/ui/card";
 11	import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge";
 12	import { ArrowLeft, Bike as BikeIcon, FileText, PenTool } from "lucide-react";
 13	import Link from 'next/link';
 14	import Image from "next/image";
 15	import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button";
 16	import { EmailForm } from "@/app/(app)/ai-email/email-form";
 17	import CommunicationLog from "./communication-log";
 18	import { CaseDetailForm } from "./case-detail-form";
 19	import { useToast } from "@/hooks/use-toast";
 20	import AccidentDetails from "./accident-details";
 21	import ImageGallery from "./image-gallery";
 22	import PdfViewer from "./pdf-viewer";
 23	import DocumentUpload from "./document-upload";
 24	import RequireWorkspace from "@/components/RequireWorkspace";
 25	
 26	export default function CasePage() {
 27	 const params = useParams();
 28	 const router = useRouter();
 29	 const caseId = params.caseId as string;
 30	 const { toast } = useToast();
 31	 const { user } = useAuth();
 32	
 33	 const [bikes] = useLocalStorage<BikeFrontend[]>("bikes", []);
 34	 const [contacts, setContacts] = useLocalStorage<Contact[]>("contacts", []);
 35	
 36	 const [caseData, setCaseData] = useState<Case | null>(null);
 37	 const [assignedBike, setAssignedBike] = useState<BikeFrontend | null>(null);
 38	 const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
 39	 const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
 40	
 41	 const [displaySection, setDisplaySection] = useState<'details' | 'gallery' | 'pdfs' | 'upload'>('details');
 42	
 43	 useEffect(() => {
 44	 const fetchCaseData = async () => {
 45	 if (!caseId || caseId === 'undefined') {
 46	 setError('Invalid case ID');
 47	 setLoading(false);
 48	 return;
 49	 }
 50	
 51	 setLoading(true);
 52	 setError(null);
 53	
 54	 try {
 55	 // Use cookieForwardFetch which automatically handles authentication
 56	 const caseResponse = await cookieForwardFetch(`/api/cases/${caseId}`, {
 57	 cache: 'no-store',
 58	 });
 59	 if (!caseResponse.ok) {
 60	 setError(caseResponse.status === 401 ? 'Unauthorized. Please re-login.' : 'Case not found');
 61	 setLoading(false);
 62	 return;
 63	 }
 64	
 65	 const currentCase: Case = await caseResponse.json();
 66	 setCaseData(currentCase);
 67	
 68	 // Find assigned bike by case ID
 69	 if (bikes.length > 0) {
 70	 const bike = bikes.find(b => b.assignedCaseId === currentCase.id);
 71	 setAssignedBike(bike || null);
 72	 }
 73	 } catch (err) {
 74	 console.error('Error fetching case data:', err);
 75	 setError('Failed to load case data');
 76	 } finally {
 77	 setLoading(false);
 78	 }
 79	 };
 80	
 81	 // Only fetch if user is available
 82	 if (user) {
 83	 fetchCaseData();
 84	 } else {
 85	 setLoading(false);
 86	 setError('Please log in to view case details');
 87	 }
 88	 }, [caseId, bikes, user]);
 89	
 90	 const handleCaseUpdate = async (updatedData: Partial<Case>) => {
 91	 if (!caseData) return;
 92	
 93	 const updatedCaseWithTimestamp: Case = {
 94	 ...caseData,
 95	 ...updatedData,
 96	 lastUpdated: 'Just now',
 97	 };
 98	
 99	 try {
 100	 const response = await cookieForwardFetch(`/api/cases/${caseData.id}`, {
 101	 method: 'PUT',
 102	 headers: {
 103	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 104	 },
 105	 body: JSON.stringify(updatedCaseWithTimestamp),
 106	 });
 107	
 108	 if (!response.ok) {
 109	 throw new Error('Failed to update case');
 110	 }
 111	
 112	 setCaseData(updatedCaseWithTimestamp);
 113	 toast({
 114	 title: "Case Updated",
 115	 description: `Details for case ${updatedCaseWithTimestamp.caseNumber} have been saved.`,
 116	 });
 117	 } catch (error) {
 118	 console.error('Error updating case:', error);
 119	 toast({
 120	 title: "Error",
 121	 description: "Failed to update case. Please try again.",
 122	 variant: "destructive",
 123	 });
 124	 }
 125	 };
 126	
 127	 const handleAddContact = (contact: Omit<Contact, 'id'>): Contact => {
 128	 const newContact: Contact = {
 129	 id: `cont-${Date.now()}`,
 130	 ...contact,
 131	 };
 132	 setContacts(prev => [newContact, ...prev]);
 133	 toast({
 134	 title: "Contact Added",
 135	 description: `New contact ${newContact.name} has been added.`
 136	 })
 137	 return newContact;
 138	 }
 139	 
 140	 if (loading) {
 141	 return (

 11	export function AuthGuard({ children }: AuthGuardProps) {
 12	 const [currentUser] = useSessionStorage<any>("currentUser", null);
 13	 const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(true);
 14	 const [redirecting, setRedirecting] = useState(false);
 15	 const router = useRouter();
 16	
 17	 useEffect(() => {
 18	 // Faster loading resolution
 19	 const timer = setTimeout(() => {
 20	 if (!currentUser && !redirecting) {
 21	 console.log('AuthGuard: No user found, redirecting to login');
 22	 setRedirecting(true);
 23	 router.push("/login");
 24	 } else if (currentUser) {
 25	 console.log('AuthGuard: User authenticated:', currentUser.email);
 26	 setIsLoading(false);
 27	 }
 28	 }, 50); // Very short delay to prevent flicker
 29	
 30	 return () => clearTimeout(timer);
 31	 }, [currentUser, router, redirecting]);
 32	
 33	 // Immediate check for existing user to skip loading state
 34	 useEffect(() => {
 35	 if (currentUser) {
 36	 setIsLoading(false);
 37	 }
 38	 }, [currentUser]);
 39	
 40	 if (redirecting) {
 41	 return (
 42	 <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
 43	 <div className="text-center">
 44	 <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-6 w-6 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mx-auto"></div>
 45	 <p className="mt-2 text-gray-600 text-sm">Redirecting to login...</p>
 46	 </div>
 47	 </div>
 48	 );
 49	 }
 50	
 51	 if (isLoading) {
 52	 return (
 53	 <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
 54	 <div className="text-center">
 55	 <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-6 w-6 border-b-2 border-blue-600 mx-auto"></div>
 56	 <p className="mt-2 text-gray-600 text-sm">Loading...</p>
 57	 </div>
 58	 </div>
 59	 );
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 if (!currentUser) {
 63	 return null; // Will redirect to login
 64	 }
 65	
 66	 return <>{children}</>;
 67	}

 69	// Initialize database with tables and seed data
 70	export async function initializeDatabase() {
 71	 if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
 72	 throw new Error('Database initialization must be performed server-side only');
 73	 }
 74	
 75	 if (isInitializing && initializationPromise) {
 76	 console.log(' Database initialization in progress, waiting...');
 77	 return initializationPromise;
 78	 }
 79	
 80	 if (pool) {
 81	 console.log(' Database already initialized, reusing connection');
 82	 return;
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 isInitializing = true;
 86	 
 87	 initializationPromise = (async () => {
 88	 try {
 89	 console.log(' Initializing PostgreSQL database...');
 90	 
 91	 // Test basic connectivity first
 92	 const databaseUrl = process.env.DATABASE_URL;
 93	 if (!databaseUrl) {
 94	 throw new Error('DATABASE_URL environment variable is required');
 95	 }
 96	 
 97	 initializePool();
 98	 
 99	 // Wait a moment for pool to initialize
 100	 await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
 101	 
 102	 await createTables();
 103	 await seedInitialData();
 104	 
 105	 console.log(' PostgreSQL database initialized successfully');
 106	 isInitializing = false;
 107	 } catch (error) {
 108	 isInitializing = false;
 109	 initializationPromise = null;
 110	 console.error(' Database initialization failed:', error);
 111	 
 112	 // Clean up pool on failure
 113	 if (pool) {
 114	 try {
 115	 await (pool as any).end();
 116	 pool = null;
 117	 } catch (cleanupError) {
 118	 console.error('Error cleaning up pool:', cleanupError);
 119	 }
 120	 }
 121	 
 122	 throw error;
 123	 }
 124	 })();
 125	 
 126	 return initializationPromise;
 127	}

 1928	// Initialize database when module is imported (server-side only)
 1929	let dbInitialized = false;
 1930	
 1931	export async function ensureDatabaseInitialized() {
 1932	 // If called on client-side, throw a helpful error
 1933	 if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
 1934	 throw new Error('Database operations must be performed server-side only. Use API routes instead.');
 1935	 }
 1936	 
 1937	 // Only initialize on server-side
 1938	 if (!dbInitialized) {
 1939	 try {
 1940	 console.log(' Ensuring PostgreSQL database is initialized...');
 1941	 await initializeDatabase();
 1942	 dbInitialized = true;
 1943	 console.log(' PostgreSQL database initialization confirmed');
 1944	 } catch (error) {
 1945	 console.error(' Failed to initialize PostgreSQL database:', error);
 1946	 throw error;
 1947	 }
 1948	 } else {
 1949	 console.log(' PostgreSQL database already confirmed initialized');
 1950	 }
 1951	}

 25	// Server component for recent cases table
 26	async function RecentCasesServer() {
 27	 await ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 28	 const cases = await (DatabaseService as any).getCasesAsync?.();
 29	 const contacts = await (DatabaseService as any).getContactsAsync?.();
 30	 
 31	 // Get the 4 most recent cases
 32	 const recentCases = cases
 33	 .sort((a, b) => new Date(b.lastUpdated || '').getTime() - new Date(a.lastUpdated || '').getTime())
 34	 .slice(0, 4);
 35	
 36	 const getContactName = (contactId?: string) => {
 37	 if (!contactId) return '-';
 38	 const contact = contacts.find(c => c.id === contactId);
 39	 return contact?.name || '-';
 40	 };
 41	
 42	 const getStatusVariant = (status: string) => {
 43	 switch (status) {
 44	 case 'New Matter': return 'outline';
 45	 case 'Closed': case 'Paid': return 'default';
 46	 case 'Demands Sent': case 'Awaiting Settlement': return 'destructive';
 47	 default: return 'secondary';
 48	 }
 49	 };
 50	
 51	 return (
 52	 <Card className="lg:col-span-3">
 53	 <CardHeader>
 54	 <CardTitle>Recent Cases</CardTitle>
 55	 <CardDescription>An overview of the most recently updated cases.</CardDescription>
 56	 </CardHeader>
 57	 <CardContent>
 58	 <Table>
 59	 <TableHeader>
 60	 <TableRow>
 61	 <TableHead>Case Number</TableHead>
 62	 <TableHead>Client</TableHead>
 63	 <TableHead>Assigned Lawyer</TableHead>
 64	 <TableHead>Assigned Rental Company</TableHead>
 65	 <TableHead>Status</TableHead>
 66	 <TableHead>Last Updated</TableHead>
 67	 </TableRow>
 68	 </TableHeader>
 69	 <TableBody>
 70	 {recentCases.map((case_) => (
 71	 <TableRow key={case_.caseNumber}>
 72	 <TableCell className="font-medium">{case_.caseNumber}</TableCell>
 73	 <TableCell>{case_.clientName}</TableCell>
 74	 <TableCell>{getContactName(case_.assigned_lawyer_id)}</TableCell>
 75	 <TableCell>{getContactName(case_.assigned_rental_company_id)}</TableCell>
 76	 <TableCell>
 77	 <Badge variant={getStatusVariant(case_.status)}>
 78	 {case_.status}
 79	 </Badge>
 80	 </TableCell>
 81	 <TableCell>{typeof case_.lastUpdated === 'string' ? case_.lastUpdated : new Date(case_.lastUpdated).toLocaleString()}</TableCell>
 82	 </TableRow>
 83	 ))}
 84	 </TableBody>
 85	 </Table>
 86	 </CardContent>
 87	 </Card>
 88	 );
 89	}
 90	
 91	// Server component for fleet chart
 92	async function FleetChartServer() {
 93	 await ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 94	 const bikes = await (DatabaseService as any).getBikesAsync?.();
 95	 
 96	 // Calculate fleet status distribution
 97	 const statusCounts = bikes.reduce((acc, bike) => {
 98	 const status = bike.status || 'Available';
 99	 acc[status] = (acc[status] || 0) + 1;
 100	 return acc;
 101	 }, {} as Record<string, number>);
 102	
 103	 const chartData = [
 104	 { status: "Available", count: statusCounts.Available || 0, fill: "var(--color-available)" },
 105	 { status: "Rented", count: statusCounts.Rented || 0, fill: "var(--color-rented)" },
 106	 { status: "Maintenance", count: statusCounts.Maintenance || 0, fill: "var(--color-maintenance)" },
 107	 ];
 108	
 109	 const chartConfig = {
 110	 count: { label: "Count" },
 111	 available: { label: "Available", color: "hsl(var(--chart-1))" },
 112	 rented: { label: "Rented", color: "hsl(var(--chart-2))" },
 113	 maintenance: { label: "Maintenance", color: "hsl(var(--chart-4))" },
 114	 };
 115	
 116	 return (
 117	 <Card className="lg:col-span-2">
 118	 <CardHeader>
 119	 <CardTitle>Fleet Status</CardTitle>
 120	 <CardDescription>Current distribution of the bike fleet.</CardDescription>
 121	 </CardHeader>
 122	 <CardContent>
 123	 <ChartContainer config={chartConfig} className="min-h-[200px] w-full">
 124	 <BarChart accessibilityLayer data={chartData} layout="vertical" margin={{ left: 10, right: 10 }}>
 125	 <YAxis
 126	 dataKey="status"
 127	 type="category"
 128	 tickLine={false}
 129	 axisLine={false}
 130	 />
 131	 <XAxis dataKey="count" type="number" hide />
 132	 <ChartTooltip
 133	 cursor={false}
 134	 content={<ChartTooltipContent hideLabel />}
 135	 />
 136	 <Bar dataKey="count" radius={5} />
 137	 </BarChart>
 138	 </ChartContainer>
 139	 </CardContent>
 140	 </Card>
 141	 );
 142	}

 156	 <div className="h-4 w-20 bg-muted animate-pulse rounded" />
 157	 <div className="h-4 w-24 bg-muted animate-pulse rounded" />

 1928	// Initialize database when module is imported (server-side only)
 1929	let dbInitialized = false;

 1931	export async function ensureDatabaseInitialized() {
 1932	 // If called on client-side, throw a helpful error
 1933	 if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
 1934	 throw new Error('Database operations must be performed server-side only. Use API routes instead.');
 1935	 }
 1936	 
 1937	 // Only initialize on server-side
 1938	 if (!dbInitialized) {
 1939	 try {
 1940	 console.log(' Ensuring PostgreSQL database is initialized...');
 1941	 await initializeDatabase();
 1942	 dbInitialized = true;
 1943	 console.log(' PostgreSQL database initialization confirmed');
 1944	 } catch (error) {
 1945	 console.error(' Failed to initialize PostgreSQL database:', error);
 1946	 throw error;
 1947	 }
 1948	 } else {
 1949	 console.log(' PostgreSQL database already confirmed initialized');
 1950	 }
 1951	}

 1	import { DatabaseService, ensureDatabaseInitialized } from './database';
 2	import { DocumentType } from './database-schema';
 3	import crypto from 'crypto';
 4	
 5	/**
 6	 * Generate a secure SHA256 token for signature access
 7	 */
 8	export function generateSignatureToken(): string {
 9	 const randomBytes = crypto.randomBytes(32);
 10	 return crypto.createHash('sha256').update(randomBytes).digest('hex');
 11	}
 12	
 13	/**
 14	 * Create a new signature token
 15	 */
 16	export async function createSignatureToken(
 17	 caseId: string,
 18	 clientEmail: string,
 19	 documentType: DocumentType,
 20	 formData: any,
 21	 formLink: string
 22	): Promise<string> {
 23	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 24	 
 25	 const token = generateSignatureToken();
 26	 const expiresAt = new Date(Date.now() + 72 * 60 * 60 * 1000).toISOString(); // 72 hours
 27	
 28	 const signatureTokenData = {
 29	 token,
 30	 case_id: caseId,
 31	 client_email: clientEmail,
 32	 form_data: formData,
 33	 status: 'pending' as const,
 34	 expires_at: expiresAt,
 35	 document_type: documentType,
 36	 form_link: formLink
 37	 };
 38	
 39	 try {
 40	 const createdToken = await DatabaseService.createSignatureToken({
 41	 created_at: new Date().toISOString(),
 42	 updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
 43	 ...signatureTokenData
 44	 });
 45	 console.log(' Signature token created in database:', { id: createdToken.id, token });
 46	 return token;
 47	 } catch (error) {
 48	 console.error('Error creating signature token:', error);
 49	 throw new Error('Failed to create signature token');
 50	 }
 51	}
 52	
 53	/**
 54	 * Retrieve a signature token by token string
 55	 */
 56	export async function getSignatureToken(token: string): Promise<any | null> {
 57	 try {
 58	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 59	 const result = await DatabaseService.getSignatureToken(token);
 60	 return result;
 61	 } catch (error) {
 62	 console.error('Error retrieving signature token:', error);
 63	 return null;
 64	 }
 65	}
 66	
 67	/**
 68	 * Validate if a token is valid and not expired
 69	 */
 70	export function isTokenValid(signatureToken: any): boolean {
 71	 const now = new Date();
 72	 const expiresAt = new Date(signatureToken.expires_at);
 73	 
 74	 return (
 75	 signatureToken.status !== 'expired' &&
 76	 signatureToken.status !== 'completed' &&
 77	 now < expiresAt
 78	 );
 79	}
 80	
 81	/**
 82	 * Update signature token status
 83	 */
 84	export async function updateSignatureTokenStatus(
 85	 tokenId: string,
 86	 status: string,
 87	 additionalData?: any
 88	): Promise<void> {
 89	 try {
 90	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 91	 const updateData: any = {
 92	 status,
 93	 ...additionalData
 94	 };
 95	
 96	 // Add timestamps for specific status changes
 97	 if (status === 'signed') {
 98	 updateData.signed_at = new Date().toISOString();
 99	 } else if (status === 'completed') {
 100	 updateData.completed_at = new Date().toISOString();
 101	 }
 102	
 103	 await DatabaseService.updateSignatureToken(tokenId, updateData);
 104	 console.log('Signature token status updated:', { tokenId, status });
 105	 } catch (error) {
 106	 console.error('Error updating signature token status:', error);
 107	 throw new Error('Failed to update signature token status');
 108	 }
 109	}
 110	
 111	/**
 112	 * Mark token as accessed (when user visits the signature portal)
 113	 */
 114	export async function markTokenAsAccessed(token: string): Promise<any | null> {
 115	 const signatureToken = await getSignatureToken(token);
 116	 
 117	 if (!signatureToken) {
 118	 return null;
 119	 }
 120	
 121	 // Check if token is still valid
 122	 if (!isTokenValid(signatureToken)) {
 123	 await updateSignatureTokenStatus(signatureToken.id, 'expired');
 124	 return null;
 125	 }
 126	
 127	 // Mark as accessed if it's still pending
 128	 if (signatureToken.status === 'pending') {
 129	 await updateSignatureTokenStatus(signatureToken.id, 'accessed');
 130	 signatureToken.status = 'accessed';
 131	 }
 132	
 133	 return signatureToken;
 134	}
 135	
 136	/**
 137	 * Complete the signature process
 138	 */
 139	export async function completeSignatureToken(
 140	 token: string,
 141	 jotformSubmissionId: string
 142	): Promise<void> {
 143	 const signatureToken = await getSignatureToken(token);
 144	 
 145	 if (!signatureToken) {
 146	 throw new Error('Signature token not found');
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 await updateSignatureTokenStatus(signatureToken.id, 'completed', {
 150	 jotform_submission_id: jotformSubmissionId
 151	 });
 152	}
 153	
 154	/**
 155	 * Get all signature tokens for a case
 156	 */
 157	export async function getSignatureTokensForCase(caseId: string): Promise<any[]> {
 158	 try {
 159	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 160	 return await DatabaseService.getSignatureTokensForCase(caseId);
 161	 } catch (error) {
 162	 console.error('Error retrieving signature tokens for case:', error);
 163	 throw new Error('Failed to retrieve signature tokens for case');
 164	 }
 165	}
 166	
 167	/**
 168	 * Check if a case already has a pending signature token for a document type
 169	 */
 170	export async function hasPendingSignatureToken(
 171	 caseId: string,
 172	 documentType: DocumentType
 173	): Promise<boolean> {
 174	 try {
 175	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 176	 const tokens = await DatabaseService.getSignatureTokensForCase(caseId);
 177	 return tokens.some(token =>
 178	 token.document_type === documentType &&
 179	 (token.status === 'pending' || token.status === 'accessed')
 180	 );
 181	 } catch (error) {
 182	 console.error('Error checking for pending signature token:', error);
 183	 return false;
 184	 }
 185	}
 186	
 187	/**
 188	 * Update signature token with correct form link
 189	 */
 190	export async function updateSignatureTokenFormLink(
 191	 token: string,
 192	 formLink: string
 193	): Promise<void> {
 194	 try {
 195	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 196	 const existingToken = await DatabaseService.getSignatureToken(token);
 197	 
 198	 if (!existingToken) {
 199	 console.error('Token not found for update:', token);
 200	 return;
 201	 }
 202	
 203	 await DatabaseService.updateSignatureToken(existingToken.id, {
 204	 form_link: formLink
 205	 });
 206	
 207	 console.log(' Updated token with form link:', { token, formLink });
 208	 } catch (error) {
 209	 console.error('Error updating token with form link:', error);
 210	 throw new Error('Failed to update signature token form link');
 211	 }
 212	}
 213	
 214	/**
 215	 * Update form data for a signature token (for draft saving)
 216	 */
 217	export async function updateSignatureTokenFormData(
 218	 token: string,
 219	 formData: any
 220	): Promise<void> {
 221	 try {
 222	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 223	
 224	 const existingToken = await DatabaseService.getSignatureToken(token);
 225	 if (!existingToken) {
 226	 throw new Error('Token not found');
 227	 }
 228	
 229	 await DatabaseService.updateSignatureToken(existingToken.id, {
 230	 form_data: formData,
 231	 updated_at: new Date().toISOString()
 232	 });
 233	
 234	 console.log(' Signature token form data updated:', token);
 235	 } catch (error) {
 236	 console.error('Error updating signature token form data:', error);
 237	 throw new Error('Failed to update signature token form data');
 238	 }
 239	}
 240	
 241	/**
 242	 * Clean up expired tokens (should be run periodically)
 243	 */
 244	export async function cleanupExpiredTokens(): Promise<number> {
 245	 try {
 246	 ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 247	 // This would need a custom query in the DatabaseService
 248	 console.log('Token cleanup not yet implemented for SQLite');
 249	 return 0;
 250	 } catch (error) {
 251	 console.error('Error cleaning up expired tokens:', error);
 252	 throw new Error('Failed to clean up expired tokens');
 253	 }
 254	}

 37	 );

 41	 console.error('Error fetching case by number:', error);
 42	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to fetch case' }, { status: 500 });
 43	 }

 49	) {

 60	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Case not found' }, { status: 404 });
 61	 }

 64	 await DatabaseService.updateCase(existingCase.id, updates);
 65	 return NextResponse.json({ success: true });

 68	 return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to update case' }, { status: 500 });

 1	import { NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 2	import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server';
 3	
 4	const PUBLIC_PATHS = [
 5	 '/', // landing if exists
 6	 '/about',
 7	 '/login',
 8	 '/first-login',
 9	 '/simple-login', // if exposed
 10	 '/forms',
 11	 '/document-signing',
 12	 '/secure-signature-portal',
 13	 '/sign-agreement',
 14	 '/test-email',
 15	 '/test-signature',
 16	];
 17	
 18	function isPublicPath(pathname: string): boolean {
 19	 if (PUBLIC_PATHS.some((p) => pathname === p || pathname.startsWith(`${p}/`))) {
 20	 return true;
 21	 }
 22	 // allow next static assets and API routes
 23	 if (
 24	 pathname.startsWith('/_next') ||
 25	 pathname.startsWith('/favicon') ||
 26	 pathname.startsWith('/public') ||
 27	 pathname.startsWith('/api/health') // health endpoint public
 28	 ) {
 29	 return true;
 30	 }
 31	 return false;
 32	}
 33	
 34	export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
 35	 const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;
 36	
 37	 // Check if this is a public path
 38	 if (isPublicPath(pathname)) {
 39	 return NextResponse.next();
 40	 }
 41	
 42	 // Protected routes that require authentication
 43	 const protectedPaths = [
 44	 '/cases',
 45	 '/fleet',
 46	 '/contacts',
 47	 '/financials',
 48	 '/interactions',
 49	 '/commitments',
 50	 '/workspaces',
 51	 '/rental-agreement',
 52	 '/collection-emails'
 53	 ];
 54	
 55	 // Check if this is a protected path
 56	 const isProtectedPath = protectedPaths.some(path =>
 57	 pathname === path || pathname.startsWith(`${path}/`)
 58	 );
 59	
 60	 // Read auth cookie set on login
 61	 const authCookie = request.cookies.get('wpa_auth');
 62	 const isAuthenticated = !!authCookie?.value;
 63	
 64	 if (isProtectedPath && !isAuthenticated) {
 65	 const loginUrl = new URL('/login', request.url);
 66	 loginUrl.searchParams.set('next', pathname);
 67	 return NextResponse.redirect(loginUrl);
 68	 }
 69	
 70	 // propagate cookie to downstream if present
 71	 const response = NextResponse.next();
 72	 return response;
 73	}
 74	
 75	export const config = {
 76	 // Restrict to application routes while excluding Next internals and static assets.
 77	 // Avoids invalid route source patterns that use capturing groups.
 78	 matcher: [
 79	 /*
 80	 * Match all request paths except for the ones starting with:
 81	 * - api (API routes)
 82	 * - _next/static (static files)
 83	 * - _next/image (image optimization files)
 84	 * - favicon.ico, sitemap.xml, robots.txt
 85	 */
 86	 '/((?!api|_next/static|_next/image|favicon\\.ico|sitemap\\.xml|robots\\.txt).*)',
 87	 ],
 88	};

 9	 test('should load commitments page without errors', async ({ page }) => {

 12

 14	 const errorMessage = page.locator('text=/failed to load|error|unable to fetch/i');

 25	 // Wait for page to load
 26	 await page.waitForLoadState('networkidle', { timeout: 10000 });
 27	 
 28	 // Click on "New Commitment" or "Add Commitment" button
 29	 const newCommitmentButton = page.locator('button').filter({ 
 30	 hasText: /new commitment|add commitment|create commitment/i

 32	 
 33	 if (await newCommitmentButton.isVisible()) {
 34	 await newCommitmentButton.click();
 35	 
 36	 // Fill in commitment form
 37	 await page.fill('input[name="title"], input[placeholder*="title"]', 'Test Commitment');
 38	 await page.fill('textarea[name="description"], textarea[placeholder*="description"]', 'Test commitment description');
 39	 
 40	 // Set amount if field exists
 41	 const amountField = page.locator('input[name="amount"], input[placeholder*="amount"]');
 42	 if (await amountField.isVisible()) {
 43	 await amountField.fill('1000');
 44	 }
 45	 
 46	 // Set date if field exists
 47	 const dateField = page.locator('input[type="date"]');
 48	 if (await dateField.isVisible()) {
 49	 const today = new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0];
 50	 await dateField.fill(today);
 51	 }
 52	 
 53	 // Save the commitment
 54	 await page.click('button:has-text("Save"), button:has-text("Create"), button:has-text("Submit")');
 55	 
 56	 // Wait for save to complete
 57	 await page.waitForLoadState('networkidle');
 58	 
 59	 // Verify no errors
 60	 const errorMessage = page.locator('text=/error|failed/i');
 61	 await expect(errorMessage).not.toBeVisible();
 62	 
 63	 // Verify success message or that commitment appears in list
 64	 const successIndicator = page.locator('text=/success|saved|created/i, text="Test Commitment"');
 65	 await expect(successIndicator).toBeVisible();
 66	 }
 67	 });
 68	
 69	 test('should display commitments list without errors', async ({ page }) => {

 1	import { test, expect } from '@playwright/test';
 2	import { 
 3	 buildJotFormURL,

 7	import { testCases } from '../fixtures/signature-test-data';
 8	
 9	test.describe('JotForm Integration', () => {
 10	 test('buildJotFormURL creates correct URL for claims form', () => {
 11	 const url = buildJotFormURL('claims', testCases.validCase, 'test-token-123');
 12	 
 13	 expect(url).toContain('https://form.jotform.com/232543267390861');
 14	 expect(url).toContain('signature_token=test-token-123');
 15	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Bfirst%5D=John'); // clientNameFirst uses field ID
 16	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Blast%5D=Doe'); // clientNameLast uses field ID
 17	 expect(url).toContain('q4_email=john.doe%40example.com'); // clientEmail uses field ID
 18	 expect(url).toContain('case_number=TEST001'); // legacy fallback field
 19	 });
 20	
 21	 test('buildJotFormURL creates correct URL for not-at-fault rental', () => {
 22	 const url = buildJotFormURL('not-at-fault-rental', testCases.validCase, 'test-token-456');
 23	 
 24	 expect(url).toContain('https://form.jotform.com/233241680987464');
 25	 expect(url).toContain('signature_token=test-token-456');
 26	 expect(url).toContain('3=John+Doe'); // hirerName field ID (+ for spaces)
 27	 expect(url).toContain('4=john.doe%40example.com'); // hirerEmail field ID
 28	 });
 29	
 30	 test('buildJotFormURL throws error for unknown document type', () => {
 31	 expect(() => {
 32	 buildJotFormURL('unknown-type' as any, testCases.validCase, 'test-token');
 33	 }).toThrow('Unknown document type: unknown-type');
 34	 });
 35	
 36	 test('validateJotFormWebhook validates correct payload', () => {
 37	 const payload = {
 38	 submission_id: '12345',
 39	 form_id: '232543267390861',
 40	 status: 'ACTIVE'
 41	 };
 42	
 43	 const result = validateJotFormWebhook(payload);
 44	 
 45	 expect(result.isValid).toBe(true);
 46	 expect(result.submissionId).toBe('12345');
 47	 expect(result.formId).toBe('232543267390861');
 48	 expect(result.error).toBeUndefined();
 49	 });
 50	
 51	 test('validateJotFormWebhook validates JSON string payload', () => {
 52	 const payload = JSON.stringify({
 53	 submissionID: '67890',
 54	 formID: '233241680987464',
 55	 status: 'ACTIVE'
 56	 });
 57	
 58	 const result = validateJotFormWebhook(payload);
 59	 
 60	 expect(result.isValid).toBe(true);
 61	 expect(result.submissionId).toBe('67890');
 62	 expect(result.formId).toBe('233241680987464');
 63	 });
 64	
 65	 test('validateJotFormWebhook rejects payload without submission ID', () => {
 66	 const payload = {
 67	 form_id: '232543267390861',
 68	 status: 'ACTIVE'
 69	 };
 70	
 71	 const result = validateJotFormWebhook(payload);
 72	 
 73	 expect(result.isValid).toBe(false);
 74	 expect(result.error).toBe('Missing submission ID');
 75	 });
 76	
 77	 test('validateJotFormWebhook rejects payload without form ID', () => {
 78	 const payload = {
 79	 submission_id: '12345',
 80	 status: 'ACTIVE'
 81	 };
 82	
 83	 const result = validateJotFormWebhook(payload);
 84	 
 85	 expect(result.isValid).toBe(false);
 86	 expect(result.error).toBe('Missing form ID');
 87	 });
 88	
 89	 test('validateJotFormWebhook rejects invalid JSON', () => {
 90	 const payload = 'invalid json {';
 91	
 92	 const result = validateJotFormWebhook(payload);
 93	 
 94	 expect(result.isValid).toBe(false);
 95	 expect(result.error).toBe('Invalid JSON payload');
 96	 });
 97	
 98	 test('getDocumentTypeFromFormId returns correct document type', () => {
 99	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('232543267390861')).toBe('claims');
 100	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('233241680987464')).toBe('not-at-fault-rental');
 101	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('233238940095055')).toBe('certis-rental');
 102	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('233183619631457')).toBe('authority-to-act');
 103	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('233061493503046')).toBe('direction-to-pay');
 104	 });
 105	
 106	 test('getDocumentTypeFromFormId returns null for unknown form ID', () => {
 107	 expect(getDocumentTypeFromFormId('999999999999999')).toBeNull();
 108	 });
 109	
 110	 test('buildJotFormURL handles special characters in case data', () => {
 111	 const caseDataWithSpecialChars = {
 112	 ...testCases.validCase,
 113	 clientName: 'John O\'Connor & Associates',
 114	 accidentDescription: 'Collision at Main St & 1st Ave'
 115	 };
 116	
 117	 const url = buildJotFormURL('claims', caseDataWithSpecialChars, 'test-token');
 118	 
 119	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Bfirst%5D=John'); // clientNameFirst field ID
 120	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Blast%5D=O%27Connor+%26+Associates'); // clientNameLast field ID (+ for spaces)
 121	 expect(url).toContain('q75_accidentDetails=Collision+at+Main+St+%26+1st+Ave'); // accidentDetails field ID (+ for spaces)
 122	 });
 123	
 124	 test('buildJotFormURL handles missing optional fields gracefully', () => {
 125	 const minimalCaseData = {
 126	 caseNumber: 'TEST001',
 127	 clientName: 'John Doe'
 128	 };
 129	
 130	 const url = buildJotFormURL('claims', minimalCaseData, 'test-token');
 131	 
 132	 expect(url).toContain('https://form.jotform.com/232543267390861');
 133	 expect(url).toContain('signature_token=test-token');
 134	 expect(url).toContain('case_number=TEST001');
 135	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Bfirst%5D=John'); // clientNameFirst field ID
 136	 expect(url).toContain('q41_driver%5Blast%5D=Doe'); // clientNameLast field ID
 137	 // Should not contain undefined or null values
 138	 expect(url).not.toContain('undefined');
 139	 expect(url).not.toContain('null');
 140	 });
 141	});

 1	import { DOCUMENT_TYPES, DocumentType } from './database-schema';
 2	import { buildJotFormURLWithFieldIds } from './jotform-field-inspector';
 3	
 4	/**
 5	 * JotForm integration utilities
 6	 */
 7	
 8	const JOTFORM_API_KEY = process.env.JOTFORM_API_KEY;
 9	const JOTFORM_BASE_URL = 'https://api.jotform.com';
 10	
 11	if (!JOTFORM_API_KEY) {
 12	 console.warn('JOTFORM_API_KEY environment variable is not set');
 13	}
 14	
 15	/**
 16	 * Build a prefilled JotForm URL with case data
 17	 * This function now uses the improved field ID mapping system
 18	 */
 19	export function buildJotFormURL(
 20	 documentType: DocumentType,
 21	 caseData: any,
 22	 signatureToken: string
 23	): string {
 24	 console.log(` Building JotForm URL for ${documentType} with improved field ID mapping`);
 25	 console.log(' Case data received:', JSON.stringify(caseData, null, 2));
 26	
 27	 try {
 28	 // Use the improved field ID mapping system
 29	 const urlWithFieldIds = buildJotFormURLWithFieldIds(documentType, caseData, signatureToken);
 30	 console.log(` Successfully generated JotForm URL with field IDs: ${urlWithFieldIds}`);
 31	 return urlWithFieldIds;
 32	 } catch (error) {
 33	 // For unknown document types, don't fall back - let the error propagate
 34	 if (error instanceof Error && error.message.includes('Unknown document type')) {
 35	 throw error;
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 // Fallback to legacy method for other errors
 39	 console.log(' Falling back to legacy URL building method...');
 40	 return buildLegacyJotFormURL(documentType, caseData, signatureToken);
 41	 }
 42	}

 44	/**
 45	 * Legacy JotForm URL building method (fallback)
 46	 * Kept for backward compatibility
 47	 */
 48	function buildLegacyJotFormURL(
 49	 documentType: DocumentType,
 50	 caseData: any,
 51	 signatureToken: string
 52	): string {
 53	 const formConfig = DOCUMENT_TYPES[documentType];
 54	 if (!formConfig) {
 55	 throw new Error(`Unknown document type: ${documentType}`);
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 const baseUrl = `https://form.jotform.com/${formConfig.jotform_id}`;
 59	 const params = new URLSearchParams();
 60	
 61	 // Add signature token for tracking
 62	 params.append('signature_token', signatureToken);
 63	
 64	 console.log(` Building legacy JotForm URL for ${documentType} with data:`, caseData);
 65	
 66	 // First, add any form field data (question IDs from the form)
 67	 if (caseData && typeof caseData === 'object') {
 68	 Object.entries(caseData).forEach(([key, value]) => {
 69	 // If the key is a number (JotForm question ID), add it as a parameter
 70	 if (/^\d+$/.test(key) && value !== undefined && value !== null && value !== '') {
 71	 params.append(key, String(value));
 72	 console.log(`Added question ID param: ${key} = ${value}`);
 73	 }
 74	 });
 75	 }
 76	
 77	 // Then map standard case data fields
 78	 // Map case data to JotForm fields based on document type
 79	 switch (documentType) {
 80	 case 'claims':
 81	 mapClaimsFormFields(params, caseData);
 82	 break;
 83	 case 'not-at-fault-rental':
 84	 mapNotAtFaultRentalFields(params, caseData);
 85	 break;
 86	 case 'certis-rental':
 87	 mapCertisRentalFields(params, caseData);
 88	 break;
 89	 case 'authority-to-act':
 90	 mapAuthorityToActFields(params, caseData);
 91	 break;
 92	 case 'direction-to-pay':
 93	 mapDirectionToPayFields(params, caseData);
 94	 break;
 95	 default:
 96	 throw new Error(`Unsupported document type: ${documentType}`);
 97	 }
 98	
 99	 const finalUrl = `${baseUrl}?${params.toString()}`;
 100	 console.log(`Generated legacy JotForm URL: ${finalUrl}`);
 101	 return finalUrl;
 102	}

 104	/**
 105	 * Map case data to Claims form fields
 106	 */
 107	function mapClaimsFormFields(params: URLSearchParams, caseData: any): void {
 108	 console.log('Mapping claims form fields:', caseData);
 109	 
 110	 // Helper function to safely add parameters
 111	 const addParam = (key: string, value: any, paramName?: string) => {
 112	 if (value !== undefined && value !== null && value !== '') {
 113	 const actualParamName = paramName || key;
 114	 params.append(actualParamName, String(value));
 115	 console.log(`Added claims param: ${actualParamName} = ${value}`);
 116	 }
 117	 };
 118	
 119	 // Client information
 120	 addParam('clientName', caseData.clientName, 'client_name');
 121	 addParam('clientEmail', caseData.clientEmail, 'client_email');
 122	 addParam('clientPhone', caseData.clientPhone, 'client_phone');
 123	 addParam('clientStreetAddress', caseData.clientStreetAddress, 'client_address');
 124	 addParam('clientSuburb', caseData.clientSuburb, 'client_suburb');
 125	 addParam('clientState', caseData.clientState, 'client_state');
 126	 addParam('clientPostcode', caseData.clientPostcode, 'client_postcode');
 127	 
 128	 // At-fault party information
 129	 addParam('atFaultPartyName', caseData.atFaultPartyName, 'af_party_name');
 130	 addParam('atFaultPartyEmail', caseData.atFaultPartyEmail, 'af_party_email');
 131	 addParam('atFaultPartyPhone', caseData.atFaultPartyPhone, 'af_party_phone');
 132	 
 133	 // Case details
 134	 addParam('caseNumber', caseData.caseNumber, 'case_number');
 135	 addParam('accidentDate', caseData.accidentDate, 'accident_date');
 136	 addParam('accidentTime', caseData.accidentTime, 'accident_time');
 137	 addParam('accidentDescription', caseData.accidentDescription, 'accident_description');
 138	 
 139	 // Insurance information
 140	 addParam('clientInsuranceCompany', caseData.clientInsuranceCompany, 'client_insurer');
 141	 addParam('clientClaimNumber', caseData.clientClaimNumber, 'client_claim_number');
 142	
 143	 // Additional fields that might be stored in form data
 144	 addParam('naf_name', caseData.naf_name);
 145	 addParam('naf_email', caseData.naf_email);
 146	 addParam('naf_phone', caseData.naf_phone);
 147	 addParam('naf_address', caseData.naf_address);
 148	 addParam('af_name', caseData.af_name);
 149	 addParam('af_phone', caseData.af_phone);
 150	 addParam('accident_location', caseData.accident_location);
 151	}

 222	/**
 223	 * Retrieve signed PDF from JotForm
 224	 */
 225	export async function getSignedPDF(
 226	 formId: string,
 227	 submissionId: string
 228	): Promise<{ buffer: Buffer; filename: string }> {
 229	 if (!JOTFORM_API_KEY) {
 230	 throw new Error('JotForm API key is not configured');
 231	 }
 232	
 233	 const url = `${JOTFORM_BASE_URL}/pdf-converter/${formId}/fill-pdf?download=1&submissionID=${submissionId}&apikey=${JOTFORM_API_KEY}`;
 234	
 235	 try {
 236	 const response = await fetch(url);
 237	 
 238	 if (!response.ok) {
 239	 throw new Error(`JotForm API error: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
 240	 }
 241	
 242	 const buffer = Buffer.from(await response.arrayBuffer());
 243	 const filename = `${formId}_${submissionId}.pdf`;
 244	
 245	 return { buffer, filename };
 246	 } catch (error) {
 247	 console.error('Error retrieving signed PDF from JotForm:', error);
 248	 throw new Error('Failed to retrieve signed PDF from JotForm');
 249	 }
 250	}
 251	
 252	/**
 253	 * Get JotForm submission details
 254	 */
 255	export async function getSubmissionDetails(submissionId: string): Promise<any> {
 256	 if (!JOTFORM_API_KEY) {
 257	 throw new Error('JotForm API key is not configured');
 258	 }
 259	
 260	 const url = `${JOTFORM_BASE_URL}/submission/${submissionId}?apikey=${JOTFORM_API_KEY}`;
 261	
 262	 try {
 263	 const response = await fetch(url);
 264	 
 265	 if (!response.ok) {
 266	 throw new Error(`JotForm API error: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
 267	 }
 268	
 269	 const data = await response.json();
 270	 return data.content;
 271	 } catch (error) {
 272	 console.error('Error retrieving submission details from JotForm:', error);
 273	 throw new Error('Failed to retrieve submission details from JotForm');
 274	 }
 275	}

 277	/**
 278	 * Validate JotForm webhook payload
 279	 */
 280	export function validateJotFormWebhook(payload: any): {
 281	 isValid: boolean;
 282	 submissionId?: string;
 283	 formId?: string;
 284	 error?: string;
 285	} {
 286	 try {
 287	 // Parse the raw request if it's a string
 288	 let data = payload;
 289	 if (typeof payload === 'string') {
 290	 data = JSON.parse(payload);
 291	 }
 292	
 293	 // Check for required fields
 294	 if (!data.submission_id && !data.submissionID) {
 295	 return { isValid: false, error: 'Missing submission ID' };
 296	 }
 297	
 298	 if (!data.form_id && !data.formID) {
 299	 return { isValid: false, error: 'Missing form ID' };
 300	 }
 301	
 302	 const submissionId = data.submission_id || data.submissionID;
 303	 const formId = data.form_id || data.formID;
 304	
 305	 return {
 306	 isValid: true,
 307	 submissionId: submissionId.toString(),
 308	 formId: formId.toString()
 309	 };
 310	 } catch (error) {
 311	 return { isValid: false, error: 'Invalid JSON payload' };
 312	 }
 313	}

 315	/**
 316	 * Get document type from JotForm form ID
 317	 */
 318	export function getDocumentTypeFromFormId(formId: string): DocumentType | null {
 319	 for (const [docType, config] of Object.entries(DOCUMENT_TYPES)) {
 320	 if (config.jotform_id === formId) {
 321	 return docType as DocumentType;
 322	 }
 323	 }
 324	 return null;
 325	}

 336	/**
 337	 * Validation Helpers
 338	 */
 339	export class ValidationHelpers {
 340	 static isValidEmail(email: string): boolean {
 341	 const emailRegex = /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/;
 342	 return emailRegex.test(email);
 343	 }
 344	
 345	 static isValidPhone(phone: string): boolean {
 346	 const phoneRegex = /^[\+]?[1-9][\d]{0,15}$/;
 347	 return phoneRegex.test(phone.replace(/[\s\-\(\)]/g, ''));
 348	 }
 349	
 350	 static isValidPostcode(postcode: string, state?: AustralianState): boolean {
 351	 const postcodeRegex = /^\d{4}$/;
 352	 return postcodeRegex.test(postcode);
 353	 }
 354	
 355	 static isValidRegistration(registration: string): boolean {
 356	 const regRegex = /^[A-Z0-9]{3,6}$/i;
 357	 return regRegex.test(registration);
 358	 }
 359	
 360	 static isValidCaseNumber(caseNumber: string): boolean {
 361	 const caseRegex = /^\d{5}$/;
 362	 return caseRegex.test(caseNumber);
 363	 }
 364	
 365	 static generateCaseNumber(week: number, month: number, sequence: number): string {
 366	 return `${week.toString().padStart(2, '0')}${month.toString().padStart(2, '0')}${sequence.toString().padStart(3, '0')}`;
 367	 }
 368	
 369	 static formatCurrency(amount: number): string {
 370	 return new Intl.NumberFormat('en-AU', {
 371	 style: 'currency',
 372	 currency: 'AUD'
 373	 }).format(amount);
 374	 }
 375	
 376	 static formatDate(date: Date | string): string {
 377	 const d = typeof date === 'string' ? new Date(date) : date;
 378	 return d.toLocaleDateString('en-AU');
 379	 }
 380	
 381	 static formatDateTime(date: Date | string): string {
 382	 const d = typeof date === 'string' ? new Date(date) : date;
 383	 return d.toLocaleString('en-AU');
 384	 }
 385	}

 143	/**
 144	 * Build JotForm URL with proper field ID mapping
 145	 */
 146	export function buildJotFormURLWithFieldIds(
 147	 documentType: DocumentType,
 148	 caseData: any,
 149	 signatureToken: string
 150	): string {
 151	 const formConfig = DOCUMENT_TYPES[documentType];
 152	 if (!formConfig) {
 153	 throw new Error(`Unknown document type: ${documentType}`);
 154	 }
 155	
 156	 const baseUrl = `https://form.jotform.com/${formConfig.jotform_id}`;
 157	 const params = new URLSearchParams();
 158	
 159	 // Add signature token
 160	 params.append('signature_token', signatureToken);
 161	
 162	 console.log(` Building JotForm URL for ${documentType} with field IDs`);
 163	 console.log(' Case data:', caseData);
 164	
 165	 // Get field mapping for this document type
 166	 const fieldMapping = JOTFORM_FIELD_MAPPINGS[documentType as keyof typeof JOTFORM_FIELD_MAPPINGS];
 167	 if (!fieldMapping) {
 168	 console.warn(` No field mapping found for document type: ${documentType}`);
 169	 return `${baseUrl}?${params.toString()}`;
 170	 }
 171	
 172	 // Map case data to JotForm field IDs
 173	 switch (documentType) {
 174	 case 'claims':
 175	 mapClaimsFormWithFieldIds(params, caseData, fieldMapping);
 176	 break;
 177	 case 'not-at-fault-rental':
 178	 mapNotAtFaultRentalWithFieldIds(params, caseData, fieldMapping);
 179	 break;
 180	 case 'certis-rental':
 181	 mapCertisRentalWithFieldIds(params, caseData, fieldMapping);
 182	 break;
 183	 case 'authority-to-act':
 184	 mapAuthorityToActWithFieldIds(params, caseData, fieldMapping);
 185	 break;
 186	 case 'direction-to-pay':
 187	 mapDirectionToPayWithFieldIds(params, caseData, fieldMapping);
 188	 break;
 189	 }
 190	
 191	 const finalUrl = `${baseUrl}?${params.toString()}`;
 192	 console.log(` Generated JotForm URL with field IDs: ${finalUrl}`);
 193	 return finalUrl;
 194	}
 195	
 196	/**
 197	 * Map claims form data using field IDs
 198	 */
 199	function mapClaimsFormWithFieldIds(params: URLSearchParams, caseData: any, fieldMapping: any): void {
 200	 console.log(' Mapping claims form with field IDs...');
 201	
 202	 const addFieldParam = (fieldKey: string, value: any, fallbackNames?: string[]) => {
 203	 if (value !== undefined && value !== null && value !== '') {
 204	 const fieldId = fieldMapping[fieldKey];
 205	 if (fieldId) {
 206	 params.append(fieldId, String(value));
 207	 console.log(` Mapped ${fieldKey} (${fieldId}) = ${value}`);
 208	 return true;
 209	 } else {
 210	 console.warn(` No field ID found for ${fieldKey}`);
 211	 
 212	 // Try fallback names
 213	 if (fallbackNames) {
 214	 fallbackNames.forEach(name => {
 215	 params.append(name, String(value));
 216	 console.log(` Fallback: ${name} = ${value}`);
 217	 });
 218	 }
 219	 return false;
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	 return false;
 223	 };
 224	
 225	 // Panel Shop information
 226	 addFieldParam('panelShopName', caseData.panelShopName || caseData.repairShop, ['panelShop', 'panel_shop']);
 227	 addFieldParam('panelShopContactFirst', caseData.panelShopContact || caseData.repairContact, ['contact']);
 228	 addFieldParam('panelShopPhone', caseData.panelShopPhone || caseData.repairPhone, ['phone']);
 229	
 230	 // Client/Driver information - split name into first/last for JotForm
 231	 const clientName = caseData.clientName || caseData.naf_name || '';
 232	 const nameParts = clientName.split(' ');
 233	 const firstName = nameParts[0] || '';
 234	 const lastName = nameParts.slice(1).join(' ') || '';
 235	
 236	 addFieldParam('clientNameFirst', firstName, ['driver', 'name']);
 237	 addFieldParam('clientNameLast', lastName, ['driver_last']);
 238	 addFieldParam('clientPhone', caseData.clientPhone || caseData.naf_phone, ['mobileNo', 'mobile']);
 239	 addFieldParam('clientEmail', caseData.clientEmail || caseData.naf_email, ['email']);
 240	 addFieldParam('clientAddress', caseData.clientStreetAddress || caseData.clientAddress || caseData.naf_address, ['address']);
 241	 addFieldParam('clientCity', caseData.clientSuburb || caseData.clientCity, ['city']);
 242	 addFieldParam('clientState', caseData.clientState, ['state']);
 243	 addFieldParam('clientPostcode', caseData.clientPostcode, ['postcode']);
 244	
 245	 // Insurance information
 246	 addFieldParam('insuranceCompany', caseData.clientInsuranceCompany || caseData.insuranceCompany || caseData.naf_insurer, ['insurance']);
 247	 addFieldParam('claimNumber', caseData.clientClaimNumber || caseData.claimNumber || caseData.naf_claim, ['claim']);
 248	
 249	 // Vehicle information
 250	 addFieldParam('make', caseData.make || caseData.naf_make, ['make']);
 251	 addFieldParam('model', caseData.model || caseData.naf_model, ['model']);
 252	 addFieldParam('year', caseData.year || caseData.naf_year, ['year']);
 253	 addFieldParam('rego', caseData.rego || caseData.naf_rego || caseData.clientVehicleRego, ['rego']);
 254	
 255	 // At-fault party information - split name into first/last
 256	 const afName = caseData.atFaultPartyName || caseData.af_name || '';
 257	 const afNameParts = afName.split(' ');
 258	 const afFirstName = afNameParts[0] || '';
 259	 const afLastName = afNameParts.slice(1).join(' ') || '';
 260	
 261	 addFieldParam('afDriverNameFirst', afFirstName, ['af_driver']);
 262	 addFieldParam('afDriverNameLast', afLastName, ['af_driver_last']);
 263	 addFieldParam('afDriverPhone', caseData.atFaultPartyPhone || caseData.af_phone, ['af_mobile']);
 264	 addFieldParam('afDriverEmail', caseData.atFaultPartyEmail || caseData.af_email, ['af_email']);

 277	 }

 352	/**
 353	 * Validate JotForm URL by testing field parameter format
 354	 */
 355	export function validateJotFormURL(url: string): {
 356	 isValid: boolean;
 357	 fieldCount: number;
 358	 hasFieldIds: boolean;
 359	 issues: string[];
 360	} {
 361	 const issues: string[] = [];
 362	 let fieldCount = 0;
 363	 let hasFieldIds = false;
 364	
 365	 try {
 366	 const urlObj = new URL(url);
 367	 const params = urlObj.searchParams;
 368	 
 369	 // Check if it's a JotForm URL
 370	 if (!url.includes('jotform.com')) {
 371	 issues.push('Not a JotForm URL');
 372	 }
 373	
 374	 // Count parameters
 375	 fieldCount = params.size;
 376	
 377	 // Check for numeric field IDs (proper JotForm prefill format)
 378	 for (const [key, value] of params.entries()) {
 379	 if (/^\d+$/.test(key)) {
 380	 hasFieldIds = true;
 381	 }
 382	 if (!value || value.trim() === '') {
 383	 issues.push(`Empty value for parameter: ${key}`);
 384	 }
 385	 }
 386	
 387	 if (fieldCount === 0) {
 388	 issues.push('No URL parameters found');
 389	 }
 390	
 391	 if (!hasFieldIds && fieldCount > 1) {
 392	 issues.push('No numeric field IDs found - may not prefill correctly');
 393	 }
 394	
 395	 } catch (error) {
 396	 issues.push(`Invalid URL format: ${(error as Error).message}`);
 397	 }
 398	
 399	 return {
 400	 isValid: issues.length === 0,
 401	 fieldCount,
 402	 hasFieldIds,
 403	 issues
 404	 };
 405	}

 415	 clientPhone: '0413063463',

 418	 };

 426	 urls.push(urlWithFieldIds);

 428	 console.error('Failed to generate URL with field IDs:', error);

 430	
 431	 // Generate URL with alternative patterns

 433	 if (formConfig) {
 434	 const baseUrl = `https://form.jotform.com/${formConfig.jotform_id}`;
 435	 const params = new URLSearchParams();

 445	 }
 446	
 447	 return urls;

 2	"use client";

 4	import { useState, useEffect } from "react";

 23	export default function CommitmentsPage() {
 24	 const router = useRouter();
 25	 const { toast } = useToast();
 26	 const { user } = useAuth();
 27	 const [commitments, setCommitments] = useLocalStorage<Commitment[]>("commitments", []);
 28	 const [cases, setCases] = useState<Case[]>([]);
 29	 const [casesLoading, setCasesLoading] = useState(true);
 30	 
 31	 const [isFormOpen, setIsFormOpen] = useState(false);
 32	 const [commitmentToEdit, setCommitmentToEdit] = useState<Commitment | null>(null);
 33	 const [isClient, setIsClient] = useState(false);
 34	
 35	 useEffect(() => {
 36	 setIsClient(true);
 37	 }, []);
 38	
 39	 useEffect(() => {
 40	 const fetchCases = async () => {
 41	 try {
 42	 setCasesLoading(true);
 43	 
 44	 // Try to fetch cases with proper error handling
 45	 const response = await fetch('/api/cases', {
 46	 method: 'GET',
 47	 headers: {
 48	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 49	 },
 50	 credentials: 'include', // Include cookies for authentication
 51	 });
 52	 
 53	 if (!response.ok) {
 54	 // Don't throw error, just log it and continue with empty cases
 55	 console.warn('Failed to fetch cases, status:', response.status);
 56	 setCases([]);
 57	 return;
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 const casesData = await response.json();
 61	 setCases(Array.isArray(casesData) ? casesData : []);
 62	 } catch (error) {
 63	 console.error('Error fetching cases:', error);
 64	 // Don't show error toast - just continue with empty cases
 65	 setCases([]);
 66	 } finally {
 67	 setCasesLoading(false);
 68	 }
 69	 };
 70	
 71	 // Fetch cases regardless of user state to avoid blocking the page
 72	 fetchCases();
 73	 }, []);
 74	
 75	 const getCommitmentsWithCaseData = (status: 'Open' | 'Closed') => {
 76	 return commitments
 77	 .filter(c => c.status === status)
 78	 .map(c => ({ ...c, caseData: cases.find(cs => cs.caseNumber === c.caseNumber) }))
 79	 .sort((a, b) => new Date(a.dueDate).getTime() - new Date(b.dueDate).getTime());
 80	 }
 81	
 82	 const openCommitments = getCommitmentsWithCaseData('Open');
 83	 const closedCommitments = getCommitmentsWithCaseData('Closed');
 84	
 85	 const handleToggleCommitment = (id: string, currentStatus: 'Open' | 'Closed') => {
 86	 const newStatus = currentStatus === 'Open' ? 'Closed' : 'Open';
 87	 setCommitments(
 88	 commitments.map(c => c.id === id ? { ...c, status: newStatus } : c)
 89	 );
 90	 toast({ title: `Commitment ${newStatus}` });
 91	 };
 92	 
 93	 const openNewForm = () => {
 94	 setCommitmentToEdit(null);
 95	 setIsFormOpen(true);
 96	 };
 97	 
 98	 const openEditForm = (commitment: Commitment) => {
 99	 setCommitmentToEdit(commitment);
 100	 setIsFormOpen(true);
 101	 };
 102	
 103	 const handleFormSubmit = (data: Omit<Commitment, 'id' | 'status'> & { id?: string }) => {
 104	 if (data.id) { // Editing existing commitment
 105	 setCommitments(prev => prev.map(c => c.id === data.id ? { ...c, ...data, dueDate: data.dueDate } as Commitment : c));
 106	 toast({ title: "Commitment Updated" });
 107	 } else { // Creating new commitment
 108	 const newCommitment: Commitment = {
 109	 id: `com-${Date.now()}`,
 110	 status: 'Open',
 111	 ...data,
 112	 };
 113	 setCommitments(prev => [newCommitment, ...prev]);
 114	 toast({ title: "Commitment Created" });
 115	 }
 116	 setIsFormOpen(false);
 117	 setCommitmentToEdit(null);
 118	 };
 119	
 120	 const getDaysRemaining = (dueDate: string) => {
 121	 const today = new Date();
 122	 today.setHours(0,0,0,0);
 123	 const due = parseISO(dueDate);
 124	 return differenceInDays(due, today);
 125	 };
 126	 
 127	 const CommitmentTable = ({ data }: { data: (Commitment & {caseData?: Case})[] }) => (
 128	 <div className="rounded-md border">
 129	 <Table>
 130	 <TableHeader>
 131	 <TableRow>
 132	 <TableHead className="w-8"></TableHead>
 133	 <TableHead>Case Number</TableHead>
 134	 <TableHead>Client</TableHead>
 135	 <TableHead>Due Date</TableHead>
 136	 <TableHead>Days Remaining</TableHead>
 137	 <TableHead>Note</TableHead>
 138	 <TableHead className="text-right">Actions</TableHead>
 139	 </TableRow>
 140	 </TableHeader>
 141	 <TableBody>
 142	 {data.length > 0 ? (
 143	 <>
 144	 {data.map(c => {
 145	 const daysRemaining = getDaysRemaining(c.dueDate);
 146	 return (

 150	 </TableCell>
 151	 <TableCell
 152	 className="font-medium hover:underline cursor-pointer"
 153	 onClick={() => router.push(`/cases/${c.caseNumber}`)}
 154	 >
 155	 {c.caseNumber}
 156	 </TableCell>
 157	 <TableCell>{c.caseData?.clientName || "N/A"}</TableCell>
 158	 <TableCell>{format(parseISO(c.dueDate), 'PPP')}</TableCell>
 159	 <TableCell>
 160	 <Badge variant={daysRemaining < 0 ? 'destructive' : 'default'}>
 161	 {daysRemaining < 0 ? `${Math.abs(daysRemaining)} days overdue` : `${daysRemaining} days`}
 162	 </Badge>
 163	 </TableCell>
 164	 <TableCell className="max-w-[300px] truncate">{c.note}</TableCell>
 165	 <TableCell className="text-right space-x-2">
 166	 <Button
 167	 variant="outline"
 168	 size="sm"
 169	 onClick={() => openEditForm(c)}
 170	 >
 171	 <Edit className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" />
 172	 Edit
 173	 </Button>
 174	 <Button
 175	 variant="ghost"
 176	 size="sm"
 177	 onClick={() => handleToggleCommitment(c.id, c.status)}
 178	 >
 179	 {c.status === 'Open' ? <CheckCircle className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" /> : <FolderOpen className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" />}
 180	 {c.status === 'Open' ? 'Close' : 'Re-open'}
 181	 </Button>
 182	 </TableCell>
 183	 </TableRow>
 184	 )
 185	 })}
 186	 </>
 187	 ) : (
 188	 <TableRow>
 189	 <TableCell colSpan={7} className="text-center h-24">No commitments found.</TableCell>
 190	 </TableRow>
 191	 )}
 192	 </TableBody>
 193	 </Table>
 194	 </div>
 195	 )
 196	
 197	 return (
 198	 <>
 199	 <div className="flex flex-col gap-6">
 200	 <div className="flex items-center justify-between">
 201	 <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold">Commitments</h1>
 202	 <Button onClick={openNewForm}>
 203	 <PlusCircle className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" /> New Commitment
 204	 </Button>
 205	 </div>
 206	
 207	 <Card>
 208	 <CardHeader>
 209	 <CardTitle>Commitment List</CardTitle>
 210	 <CardDescription>
 211	 All follow-ups and deadlines across all cases.
 212	 </CardDescription>
 213	 </CardHeader>
 214	 <CardContent>
 215	 {isClient && !casesLoading ? (
 216	 <Tabs defaultValue="open">
 217	 <TabsList className="mb-4">
 218	 <TabsTrigger value="open"><FolderOpen className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" /> Open ({openCommitments.length})</TabsTrigger>
 219	 <TabsTrigger value="closed"><FolderClosed className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" /> Closed ({closedCommitments.length})</TabsTrigger>
 220	 </TabsList>
 221	 <TabsContent value="open">
 222	 <CommitmentTable data={openCommitments} />
 223	 </TabsContent>
 224	 <TabsContent value="closed">
 225	 <CommitmentTable data={closedCommitments} />
 226	 </TabsContent>
 227	 </Tabs>
 228	 ) : (
 229	 <div className="space-y-4">
 230	 <div className="flex space-x-2">
 231	 <div className="h-10 w-32 rounded-md bg-muted animate-pulse" />
 232	 <div className="h-10 w-32 rounded-md bg-muted animate-pulse" />
 233	 </div>
 234	 <div className="h-64 rounded-md border bg-muted animate-pulse" />
 235	 </div>
 236	 )}
 237	 </CardContent>
 238	 </Card>
 239	 </div>
 240	 
 241	 <Dialog open={isFormOpen} onOpenChange={setIsFormOpen}>
 242	 <DialogContent>
 243	 <DialogHeader>
 244	 <DialogTitle>{commitmentToEdit ? 'Edit' : 'Create New'} Commitment</DialogTitle>
 245	 <DialogDescription>
 246	 {commitmentToEdit ? 'Update the details for this commitment.' : 'Create a new follow-up or deadline.'}
 247	 </DialogDescription>
 248	 </DialogHeader>
 249	 <NewCommitmentForm 
 250	 cases={cases}
 251	 commitmentToEdit={commitmentToEdit}
 252	 onSubmit={handleFormSubmit}
 253	 setDialogOpen={setIsFormOpen}
 254	 />
 255	 </DialogContent>
 256	 </Dialog>
 257	 </>
 258	 );
 259	}

 38	
 39	export function NewCommitmentForm({ cases, commitmentToEdit, onSubmit, setDialogOpen }: CommitmentFormProps) {

 51	
 52	 const handleFormSubmit = (values: FormValues) => {
 53	 onSubmit({
 54	 ...values,
 55	 id: commitmentToEdit?.id,
 56	 dueDate: format(values.dueDate, "yyyy-MM-dd"),
 57	 });
 58	 };
 59	
 60	 return (
 61	 <Form {...form}>
 62	 <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(handleFormSubmit)} className="space-y-4 pt-4">
 63	 <FormField
 64	 control={form.control}
 65	 name="caseNumber"
 66	 render={({ field }) => (

 73	 </SelectTrigger>
 74	 </FormControl>
 75	 <SelectContent>
 76	 {cases && cases.length > 0 ? (
 77	 cases.map(c => (
 78	 <SelectItem key={c.caseNumber} value={c.caseNumber}>
 79	 {c.caseNumber} - {c.clientName}
 80	 </SelectItem>
 81	 ))
 82	 ) : (
 83	 <SelectItem value="manual" disabled>
 84	 No cases available - Enter manually
 85	 </SelectItem>
 86	 )}
 87	 </SelectContent>
 88	 </Select>
 89	 <FormMessage />
 90	 </FormItem>
 91	 )}
 92	 />
 93	 <FormField
 94	 control={form.control}
 95	 name="dueDate"
 96	 render={({ field }) => (

 98	 <FormLabel>Due Date</FormLabel>
 99	 <Popover>
 100	 <PopoverTrigger asChild>
 101	 <FormControl>
 102	 <Button
 103	 variant={"outline"}
 104	 className={cn(
 105	 "pl-3 text-left font-normal",
 106	 !field.value && "text-muted-foreground"
 107	 )}
 108	 >
 109	 {field.value ? format(field.value, "PPP") : <span>Pick a date</span>}
 110	 <CalendarIcon className="ml-auto h-4 w-4 opacity-50" />
 111	 </Button>
 112	 </FormControl>
 113	 </PopoverTrigger>
 114	 <PopoverContent className="w-auto p-0" align="start">
 115	 <Calendar
 116	 mode="single"
 117	 selected={field.value}
 118	 onSelect={field.onChange}
 119	 disabled={(date) => date < new Date("1900-01-01")}
 120	 initialFocus
 121	 />
 122	 </PopoverContent>
 123	 </Popover>
 124	 <FormMessage />
 125	 </FormItem>
 126	 )}
 127	 />
 128	 <FormField
 129	 control={form.control}
 130	 name="note"
 131	 render={({ field }) => (
 132	 <FormItem>
 133	 <FormLabel>Note</FormLabel>
 134	 <FormControl>
 135	 <Textarea
 136	 placeholder="Enter commitment details, e.g., 'Follow up with insurer for settlement offer'"
 137	 className="resize-none"
 138	 {...field}
 139	 />
 140	 </FormControl>
 141	 <FormMessage />
 142	 </FormItem>
 143	 )}
 144	 />
 145	 <DialogFooter>
 146	 <Button type="button" variant="ghost" onClick={() => setDialogOpen(false)}>Cancel</Button>
 147	 <Button type="submit">{commitmentToEdit ? 'Save Changes' : 'Create Commitment'}</Button>
 148	 </DialogFooter>
 149	 </form>
 150	 </Form>
 151	 );
 152	}

 1	import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react';
 2	import { useSessionStorage } from '../hooks/use-session-storage';
 3	
 4	type User = {
 5	 id: string;
 6	 email: string;
 7	 role: string;
 8	 name: string;
 9	 contactId?: string;
 10	 workspaceId?: string;
 11	};
 12	
 13	type AuthContextType = {
 14	 user: User | null;
 15	 loading: boolean;
 16	 logout: () => void;
 17	 login: (user: User) => void;
 18	};
 19	
 20	const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType>({
 21	 user: null,
 22	 loading: true,
 23	 logout: () => {},
 24	 login: () => {},
 25	});
 26	
 27	export function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
 28	 const [user, setUser] = useSessionStorage<User | null>('currentUser', null);
 29	 const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
 30	
 31	 useEffect(() => {
 32	 // Simple initialization without loops
 33	 setLoading(false);
 34	 }, []);
 35	
 36	 const logout = () => {
 37	 setUser(null);
 38	 // Clear all workspace-related session storage
 39	 sessionStorage.removeItem('activeWorkspace');
 40	 sessionStorage.removeItem('role');
 41	 sessionStorage.removeItem('workspaceName');
 42	 sessionStorage.removeItem('contactType');
 43	 if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
 44	 window.location.href = '/login';
 45	 }
 46	 };
 47	
 48	 const login = (userData: User) => {
 49	 setUser(userData);
 50	 
 51	 // Initialize workspace context based on user role and workspace assignment
 52	 if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
 53	 const { workspaceId, role } = userData;
 54	 
 55	 // Set role in session storage
 56	 const userRole = role === 'admin' || role === 'developer' ? 'admin' : 'workspace';
 57	 sessionStorage.setItem('role', JSON.stringify(userRole));
 58	 
 59	 // Set active workspace
 60	 const activeWorkspace = workspaceId ?? 'MAIN';
 61	 sessionStorage.setItem('activeWorkspace', JSON.stringify(activeWorkspace));
 62	 
 63	 // Dispatch events for same-tab synchronization
 64	 window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('sessionStorageChange', {
 65	 detail: { key: 'role', value: userRole }
 66	 }));
 67	 window.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('sessionStorageChange', {
 68	 detail: { key: 'activeWorkspace', value: activeWorkspace }
 69	 }));
 70	 }
 71	 };
 72	
 73	 return (
 74	 <AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, loading, logout, login }}>
 75	 {children}
 76	 </AuthContext.Provider>
 77	 );
 78	}
 79	
 80	export const useAuth = () => useContext(AuthContext);...

 1	import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 2	import { DatabaseService, ensureDatabaseInitialized } from '@/lib/database';
 3	import { createToken } from '@/lib/server-auth';
 4	import CryptoJS from 'crypto-js';
 5	
 6	const hashPassword = (password: string): string => {
 7	 return CryptoJS.SHA256(password + 'salt_pbr_2024').toString();
 8	};
 9	
 10	export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
 11	 try {
 12	 // Ensure database is initialized
 13	 await ensureDatabaseInitialized();
 14	
 15	 const { email, password } = await request.json();
 16	
 17	 if (!email || !password) {
 18	 return NextResponse.json(
 19	 { error: 'Email and password are required' },
 20	 { status: 400 }
 21	 );
 22	 }
 23	
 24	 // Get user from PostgreSQL database
 25	 const user = await DatabaseService.getUserByEmail(email.toLowerCase());
 26	
 27	 if (!user) {
 28	 return NextResponse.json(
 29	 { error: 'Invalid credentials' },
 30	 { status: 401 }
 31	 );
 32	 }
 33	
 34	 // Verify password
 35	 const hashedPassword = hashPassword(password);
 36	 if (user.password_hash !== hashedPassword) {
 37	 return NextResponse.json(
 38	 { error: 'Invalid credentials' },
 39	 { status: 401 }
 40	 );
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 // Check if account is active
 44	 if (user.status !== 'active') {
 45	 return NextResponse.json(
 46	 { error: 'Account is disabled' },
 47	 { status: 401 }
 48	 );
 49	 }
 50	
 51	 // Update last login
 52	 await DatabaseService.updateUserAccount(user.id, {
 53	 last_login: new Date().toISOString()
 54	 });
 55	
 56	 // Create JWT token
 57	 const token = createToken({
 58	 id: user.id,
 59	 email: user.email,
 60	 role: user.role,
 61	 workspaceId: user.workspace_id
 62	 });
 63	
 64	 // Create response
 65	 const response = NextResponse.json({
 66	 success: true,
 67	 user: {
 68	 id: user.id,
 69	 email: user.email,
 70	 role: user.role,
 71	 workspaceId: user.workspace_id,
 72	 firstLogin: user.first_login
 73	 },
 74	 token
 75	 });
 76	
 77	 // Set HTTP-only cookie
 78	 response.cookies.set('auth-token', token, {
 79	 httpOnly: true,
 80	 secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production',
 81	 sameSite: 'lax',
 82	 maxAge: 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 // 7 days
 83	 });
 84	
 85	 return response;
 86	 } catch (error) {
 87	 console.error('Login error:', error);
 88	 return NextResponse.json(
 89	 { error: 'Internal server error', details: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error' },
 90	 { status: 500 }
 91	 );
 92	 }
 93	}...

 12	 if (!user) {

 31	 { status: 500 }
 32	 );

 34	}

 1	/**
 2	 * cookieForwardFetch()
 3	 * Always forwards document cookies for internal client fetches to API routes.
 4	 * Useful when client auth context may not yet be hydrated; API can derive auth from wpa_auth cookie.
 5	 */
 6	export async function cookieForwardFetch(input: string, init: RequestInit = {}) {
 7	 const headers: Record<string, string> = {};
 8	
 9	 if (typeof document !== 'undefined') {
 10	 const cookie = document.cookie || '';
 11	 if (cookie) headers['cookie'] = cookie;
 12	 }
 13	
 14	 const mergedHeaders = {
 15	 ...(init.headers as Record<string, string> | undefined),
 16	 ...headers,
 17	 };
 18	
 19	 return fetch(input, { ...init, headers: mergedHeaders });
 20	}
